com.samysadi.acs.virtualization.job.operation

Interface RemoteOperation<Resource>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Cloneable, Entity, Notifier, Operation<Resource>, Probed, RunnableEntity
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    NetworkOperation
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    NetworkOperationDefault

    public interface RemoteOperation<Resource>
extends Operation<Resource>
    This interface describes an Operation that has also a destination Job.

    RemoteOperations cannot be started if their destination job is not running.
    Also, Job implementations must pause / start / cancel RemoteOperations accordingly if they are paused / started / canceled. Please see Job documentation for more information.

    Since:
    1.0

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        RemoteOperation<Resource> clone()
        Description copied from interface: Entity
        Creates a clone of this entity and sets its parent to null.

        This is a deep clone method which also clones children entities and sets their parents to the newly created clone.

        Implementations must ensure that the new clone will be independent from the current entity.

        Specified by:
        clone in interface Entity
        Specified by:
        clone in interface Notifier
        Specified by:
        clone in interface Operation<Resource>
        Specified by:
        clone in interface RunnableEntity

      • getDestinationJob

        Job getDestinationJob()
        Returns the destination job where the operation's data will be sent.
        Returns:
        the destination job

      • setDestinationJob

        void setDestinationJob(Job destinationJob)
        Sets the new destinationJob.

        A NotificationCodes.OPERATION_DEST_JOB_CHANGED is thrown.
        The old destinationJob is notified using NotificationCodes.JOB_DEST_OPERATION_REMOVED.
        The new destinationJob is notified using NotificationCodes.JOB_DEST_OPERATION_ADDED.

        Parameters:
        destinationJob - the new destinationJob
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this operation is already running
